experience: You and Sean both know Dr. DARRELL RICHARDSON, Mission Critical Ops, Lance Klem, and 54 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
Sean worked at Charles Schwab before you started

2-3 times a week I talk to a Talent Acquisition leader who informs me that their company doesn't use search firms; never ever, not for any roles. They argue that they and their team have it all under control and shouldn't ever need a guy like me. One guy said, "if I used you I'd be failing". This is just bad business. I work with multiple Fortune 100 clients on a consistent basis; companies with hundreds of internal recruiters. They understand that what I do, the service I provide, is very different from what an internal recruiting  team does. In fact, we complement one another. Using a headhunter isn't a failure, it's an investment. And like any other investment, when done properly you'll see increased returns.

Executive [CEO, COO, CFO, CIO] technology consulting and advisory servicesInterim CIO, CDO, COO engagementsCyber and Information Security Strategy and Road Map DevelopmentPre and Post Sales  ActivitiesBusiness Development

recommendations: Kimberly Hendricks
Senior Independent Recruitment Consultant
September 18, 2013, Sean was a client of Kimberly’s

Sean is an Executive / Advisor / Consultant that brings to the table a unique mix of technical, business and operations expertise. His deep, diverse experience across multiple disciplines and industries makes him a valuable asset to an organization.  While being highly professional, he possesses the ability to connect with people, no matter what level of the organization someone might work or what their skill set might be. He is approachable and an excellent listener, which makes him a strong leader, that his colleagues like and respect. It is important to Sean that his staff is well informed, supported and trained to ensure their happiness and success.  Sean is the type of Director / Executive that people will look back on their career and be grateful for having worked for Sean, knowing how much they learned from him. It has been my pleasure to work with Sean and I strongly recommend him for any senior C-Level / Director position where he can fully utilize the breadth of his experience.

Sean is a great people manager who knows how to build high performing teams; any company would be lucky to have him in a senior executive role.

summary: Greater than twenty years of technology team and ultimately entire technology department leadership have helped me learn and develop in the following areas:•	First and foremost, I must be a business leader -intimate with the how my firm earns money and impacts stakeholders•	Transformation is never done -today’s tech will be tomorrow’s legacy if currency and focus on evolution of technology are not part of a technology  plan•	People development, and succession planning, are an absolute must in having a sustainable IT organization that knows how to transform every day•	I must be technology agnostic -willing to investigate and embrace the best technology to exceed corporate expectations•	It is a constant battle and requires dedicated focus to shift my IT organizations from fire-fighting mode with an over-emphasis on tactical support, to one that delivers greater strategic and innovative results•	I consciously focus on maintaining business acumen and not solely on technical skill set•	The technology department must have a road-map -the core skills and experience required here are visioning, strategic planning, strategic execution, and ongoing assessment and adjustment•	Technology decisions must be made on the needs and priorities of the business. Understanding those needs and priorities comes through continual communication, education and collaboration.  The needs of the business are changing more and more rapidly, which means a technology leader who can build a responsive and agile IT organization, prompting the building of a responsive and agile enterprise architecture upon which the business runs is invaluablehttp://hellophello.net/hi/seanharding
